signal_description:
Select the 'Last PO Vendor Name' column, 
the 'Inv. Company Code Text' column, 
create a new column called 'PO Category' that will have the value 'Non-PO Invoice' if the 'Last PO Id' column is NULL, else it will have the value 'PO Invoice',
select the 'Inv. Document Type Text' column,
the 'Last PO Purchasing Group' column,
the 'Last PO Type' column,
the 'Last PO Item Material Group' column,
the 'Last PO Item Plant Name' column,
count the number of rows in the 'Inv. Accounting Document Number' column and call it 'No. paid late Invoices',
sum the values in the 'Inv. Converted USD Amount' column and call it 'Invoice Amount in $'
from the 'defaultview-225' table
where the value in the 'Last Inv. Item Due Date' column is before the value in the 'Last Inv. Item Clearing Date' column
group by the first 8 columns
order by the 'Last PO Item Plant Name' column in descending order
llm_output:
{
"signal_description": "Select the 'Last PO Vendor Name' column, 
the 'Inv. Company Code Text' column, 
create a new column called 'PO Category' that will have the value 'Non-PO Invoice' if the 'Last PO Id' column is NULL, else it will have the value 'PO Invoice',
select the 'Inv. Document Type Text' column,
the 'Last PO Purchasing Group' column,
the 'Last PO Type' column,
the 'Last PO Item Material Group' column,
the 'Last PO Item Plant Name' column,
count the number of rows in the 'Inv. Accounting Document Number' column and call it 'No. paid late Invoices',
sum the values in the 'Inv. Converted USD Amount' column and call it 'Invoice Amount in $'
from the 'defaultview-225' table
where the value in the 'Last Inv. Item Due Date' column is before the value in the 'Last Inv. Item Clearing Date' column
group by the first 8 columns
order by the 'Last PO Item Plant Name' column in descending order"
}
llm_input:
You are SIGNAL assistant, a part of SAP Signavio's Process Intelligence Suite. 
SIGNAL stands for Signavio Analytics Language. 
SIGNAL is a dialect of SQL.
Your goal is to help users craft SIGNAL 
queries and understand the SIGNAL language better. 

Task to solve:

Summarize the given SIGNAL query as a human-readable description with explicit reference to the table name,
the column names and respective values if they are used in the Signal query.
Summarization style should look like a set of the instructions written by human who knows the table name, columns schema and respective values. 
Explain how this signal_description was constructed.

SIGNAL query: 
SELECT
  "Last PO Vendor Name",
  "Inv. Company Code Text",
  CASE
    WHEN "Last PO Id" IS NULL THEN 'Non-PO Invoice'
    ELSE 'PO Invoice'
  END AS "PO Category",
  "Inv. Document Type Text",
  "Last PO Purchasing Group",
  "Last PO Type",
  "Last PO Item Material Group",
  "Last PO Item Plant Name",
  COUNT("Inv. Accounting Document Number") AS "No. paid late Invoices",
  SUM ("Inv. Converted USD Amount") AS "Invoice Amount in $"
FROM
  "defaultview-225"
WHERE
  (
    "Last Inv. Item Due Date" < "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date"
  )
GROUP BY
  1,
  2,
  3,
  4,
  5,
  6,
  7,
  8
ORDER BY
  8 DESC 
 
Expected output result is in JSON format:
{
"signal_description": text of the Signal summary should be here
}
Do not output any other text, apart from the above JSON.
